item.value: The tallest person in the world was Robert Wadlow. He was 2.72 meters ( 8ft 11in ) tall.
The longest word in a major English dictionary is 'Pneumonoultramicroscopicsilicovolcanoconiosis'. It is 45 characters long.
The explosion of Mount Tambora in Indonesia in 1815 has been called the loudest sound ever heard by humans.
The launch of the Russian Spiknit 1 spcecraft started the 'space race' between Russia and America. Explorer 1 was the first spacecraft launched by the United States on 31 January 1958.
In the Summer of 1896 the first modern Olympics was held in Athens, Greece. The 2012 Olympics will be held in London.
The creator of the first working light bulb was Joseph Wilson Swan. Thomas Edison improved on Swan's design by using a better incandescent material and a higher vacuum.
The blue whale can produce the loudest sound of any living animal. The sound can be detected as far away as 530 miles.
On April 30, 1789, George Washington became the first President of the United States.
On average, Elephants sleep for about 2 hours per day.
The average distance from the earth to the Sun is 150 million kilometers (93 million miles). If you could travel from Earth to the Sun in a plane it would take you 17 years
Alexander Graham Bell is credited with inventing the first telephone in 1876.
Diamonds are the hardest substance known to man. A diamond is 58 times harder than the next hardest mineral on earth.
Alaska is the largest state in America.
Intel introduces the first microprocessor, the Intel 4004 on November 15, 1971.
The blue whale is the largest known animal on Earth. The second largest animal is the Afican elephant.
The biggest planet in the Solar System is Jupiter. It is 317 times as heavy as the earth
Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world. It is 8850 meters (29035ft) high.
There are more than 2,700 languages ( + more than 7,000 dialects) in the world. More than 1,000 different languages are spoken on the continent of Africa.
The world's shortest alphabet, used in the Solomon Islands, has only 11.
The Sun's outer layer has a temperature of 6,000C . Inside the sun the temperature is 15,000,000 C.
